final_answer.precision_note: Given data are ~3 s.f.; report c to 3 s.f. (0.0200 mol dm-3).

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2 (with V1 and V2 in the same volume units so cm3 cancels). Take c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3, V1 = 25.0 cm3, and V2 = 250.0 cm3. Rearrange to c2 = c1 × V1 / V2 = 0.200 × (25.0/250.0) = 0.200 × 0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Tenfold increase in volume (25.0 to 250.0 cm3) should give tenfold decrease in concentration, matching 0.200 → 0.0200.
Units remain mol dm-3 because only the volume ratio is used in the dilution equation.
